messages.title: Darren Says...
messages.content: My name is Darren Woodiwiss and I have lived in Market Harborough since 1991 and within the Welland ward since 1997. Professionally I am an Agile Software Engineer and am used to providing solutions to complex problems. I am married to Laura and am the proud father of three; and it is because of our responsibilities to our children and the future generations that I am standing for election.

This election comes at a pivotal time for our country, one where we are about to start a journey away from our long term partners in Europe. Currently the EU protects, our environment, our workers and indeed our human rights and we must not allow these to be put aside as secondary concerns.
We need a strong voice to keep these issues on the agenda as our future relationship with the EU is negotiated at breakneck speed by our government.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Delayed Electrification of the East Midlands Mainline, Cuts to local bus services, Wide scale housing developments without infrastructure improvements
Cottage hospitals closed, Creeping privatisation, Unequal access to all services, Kettering hospital in special measures
Budget cuts to local schools: Robert Smyth cut 5%, Farndon Fields cut 12%, Ridgeway cut 10%, St Josephs cut 11%, Little Bowden cut 8%
